CONJUGATES: perfects | perfecting | perfected | more perfect | most perfect
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin perfectus, past participle of perficio ('to finish, complete'), from per- ('through, thoroughly') + facio ('to do, make').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word naming an attribute of a noun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having all the required or desirable elements, qualities, or characteristics; as good as it is possible to be; flawless.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 具备所有必需或理想的元素、品质或特征；尽善尽美；完美无缺的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: That was a perfect solution to the difficult problem.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那是解决这个难题的一个完美方案。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word naming an attribute of a noun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Total or absolute; used to intensify the noun it precedes.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 完全的；彻底的；纯粹的（用于加强语气）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was a perfect stranger when he first arrived in town.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他初次来到镇上时，完全是一个陌生人。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb (requires a direct object) | intransitive verb (does not require a direct object). Note: Verb pronunciation is /pərˈfekt/.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make something completely free from faults or defects, or to bring it to its highest state of development.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使某物完美无缺，或使其达到最高的完善状态；精进。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She spent years perfecting her technique on the piano.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她花了数年时间来完善她的钢琴技巧。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word naming an attribute of a noun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (In grammar) Denoting a tense used to describe an action that has been completed before the time of speaking or before a reference time (e.g., 'I have eaten').
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （语法）表示已完成的动作或状态（如完成时态）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: English uses the perfect aspect to show the relationship between two different points in time.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 英语使用完成体来展示两个不同时间点之间的关系。
